metadata.title: CVE-2017-7794 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
On Linux systems, if the content process is compromised, the sandbox brokerwill allow files to be truncated even though the sandbox explicitly onlyhas read access to the local file system and no write permissions. Note:This attack only affects the Linux operating system. Other operatingsystems are not affected. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 55.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7794` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
